alert.note: Alert for Eastern Franklin; Eastern Hampden; Eastern Hampshire; Northern Worcester; Northwest Middlesex County; Southern Worcester; Western Hampden; Western Hampshire (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 6:07PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...LINE OF STRONG THUNDERSTORMS CROSSING SOUTHERN NEW ENGLAND... At 605 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms in western Massachusetts along a line extending from Royalston to near Amherst to near Tolland. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Strong winds could cause minor damage such as downed branches. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Chicopee, Westfield, Holyoke, Amherst, Northampton, West Springfield, South Hadley, Easthampton, Belchertown and Athol around 610 PM EDT. Springfield, Fitchburg, Wilbraham, Palmer, Westminster, West Brookfield, Ashby, Oakham and New Braintree around 625 PM EDT. Pepperell, Leicester, Groton, West Boylston, Shirley and East Brookfield around 645 PM EDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. Do not drive through flooded roads or underpasses. Avoid low lying areas near small streams. These storms may intensify and become severe. Stay tuned to your local media for updates and possible warnings. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for western, central and northeastern Massachusetts.
